result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francisco NMI Salgado-Cobos

records.addlTxt: 3:42 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Francisco NMI Salgado-Cobos not in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. State requests Court to complete bail bond forfeiture. Court orders completion of bail bond forfeiture.
No Failure to Appear for Initial Appearance held DNA databank emailed notified of error.

11:32 AM /room 301/Defendant Francisco NMI Salgado-Cobos not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Susan Rascon in court. State requests warrant body nationwide, and forfeit bond. Court authorizes warrant body only, nationwide, and forfeit any bond pending hearing with notice to defendant and poster.

No controlled substances without prescription. 
No contact with child witness. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

3:32 PM Defendant Francisco NMI Salgado-Cobos appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Susan Rascon, Interpreter appearing via zoom. Interpreter sworn in under oath. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. questions charges, court cannot explain today only needs to inform Def. of charges. Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty or Def. may represent themselves. Def. does wish to obtain counsel and court directs Def. to contact the PD office within 7 days of today's date. State makes bond recommendation. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with child witness. Court questions Def. Def. makes statement regarding bond. Court has heard from both the State and Def. and considers 3 factors in setting bond and orders $1,500.00 cash bond with conditions of no controlled substances without prescription and no contact with child witness. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
